profile_positions.description:
Depression is a large societal problem,as it is predicted to become the most disabling disease in high-income countries by 2030. Despite the availability of effective treatments, the number of patients receiving treatment is limited. 

Internet based therapies seem to be promising, viable and feasible approaches to treating common mental disorders. Extensive research established the clinical and cost-effectiveness of eMental health from patient, clinical, technological and societal point of view and continues to strengthen the proof even more.

However, these evidence-based interventions often do not enter routine mental healthcare. To contribute to lowering the burden depression places on people and society, high quality insight in the Implementation processes and the factors that hamper or facilitate implementation and up scaling of evidence-base eMental health interventions in routine practice is needed.

I aim to contribute to this by evaluating the up scaling and implementation of computerised Cognitive Beviour Therapy and Videoconferencing in routine practice throughout Europe.
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.description:
Implementation, seen as a process in which people intend to bring into operation new or modified practices, takes place in a context and faces varying barriers within and across systems. Tailored implementation can effectively and efficiently change practices. Tailoring is a systematic process that includes identifying the factors hindering and facilitating implementation, design implementation interventions appropriate to those determinants, and the actual application of those interventions. ImpleMentAll will develop and test tailored implementation strategies for Internet-based Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (iCBT) in 9 countries including the Netherlands, Germany, France, Spain, Denmark, Italy, Kosovo, Albania, and Australia. The project is funded by the EU Horizon 2020 program and the Australian Government. It has a budget of 6 million Euro, started in January 2017 and runs for 4 years.
 
The tailored implementation strategies and the study design will be based on the Normalisation Process Theory (NPT), novel implementation measurement instruments (NoMAD), and on an established eHealth Technology Assessment methodology (MAST). Following a clustered stepped-wedge RCT design, the tailored implementation strategies will be introduced in the participating organisations at randomly chosen moments. By measuring uptake and level of normalisation of iCBT before and after the introduction over a period of 24 months, the effectiveness of tailored implementation strategies can be compared to implementation-as-usual.
 
The tailored implementation strategies of ImpleMentAll will enable data-driven evaluation of eHealth implementation projects in terms key performance indicators for process, effectiveness, and efficiency outcomes. Its methods, materials, and strategies will provide concrete guidance on how to tune implementation interventions to local determinants of practice within and across a variety of healthcare systems.
profile_positions.title: Scientific coordinator ImpleMentAll project

profile_positions.description:
E-COMPARED aims to significantly advance the scientific evidence base in eMental Health. In eight European countries, regular care for depression is compared to ‘blended’ service delivery combining mobile and internet technologies with face-to-face treatment. To explore which treatment works best, for whom, and under what circumstances, E-COMPARED employs pragmatic randomised controlled trials, advanced ICT platforms, artificial intelligence, and advanced predictive economic modelling.

E-COMPARED is an international collaborative project and is funded by the European Commission through it's Seventh Framework Program. The budget amounts to 7.7 million Euro and runs from january 2014 to 2017. Together with prof. dr. Heleen Riper who coordinates E-COMPARED, I am responsible for the overall project management.

Please see E-COMPARED.eu for more information.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager E-COMPARED

profile_positions.description:
The MasterMind project aims to provide insight into the factors that promote or hinder the uptake and implementation of evidence-based Internet interventions by mental healthcare practice. Internet-based Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (iCBT) and videoconferencing facilitating collaborative care (ccVC) is implemented in routine mental healthcare. The services will be offered to 5230 depressed adults in 15 European regions.

These 15 implementation projects are evaluated on three levels: patients, professionals, and organisations. Mixed-methods are used to provide an understanding of what (quantitative) the implementation projects have achieved and their meaning to various stakeholders (qualitative).

My role in this large scale implementation and upscaling project is to design and coordinate the scientific evaluation study.

profile_positions.description:
In this position I advised excellent researchers, research groups, research institutes and faculties and international consortia in successfully obtaining public funds for conducting word class research.

During my time at PwC and my current position at the VU and VUmc, I gained ample expertise and experience in designing complex multidisciplinary research projects both in collaboration with individual world class researchers as well as large international consortia. Besides advising in project design, I gained a vast amount of experience in writing successful proposals, process management and financial and administrative aspects of complex collaborative research projects.

I specialised in the highly competitive and complex European and national research grants, a.o.:
- FP7 and Horizon 2020 - ERC (StG, CoG, AdG, SyG)
- FP7 - Cooperation (Health, ICT, ENV, KBBE, SSH), and Horizon 2020 - Societal Challenges
- FP7 and Horizon 2020 - Marie Curie (ITN and Individual Fellowships)
- NWO - Innovative Research scheme (VENI/VIDI/VICI)
- NWO - TOP and Open Competition

On a strategic level, I advised group leaders, departments, faculty boards and deans in enlarging their acquisition capacities in public funding and strengthening related success factors. This included preparing for Horizon 2020 and related paradigm-shift in multisectoral collaborations and activating the entire innovation chain.

profile_positions.description:
Besides accounting, PwC offers strategic advice in multiple complex and challenging questions. The obtainment of large grants and incentives as well as strategic incorporation grant acquisition and realisation in the organisation, is only one of them.

At PwC I started my working career in grants and incentives. Over time I became an experienced advisor in both national and international grants and incentives. As such I advised private parties as well as public research organisations in obtaining and realising both smaller as well as the larger €10M+ grants. My role comprised process- and consortium management as well as advice on project and research design and project management. Furthermore, I was responsible for meeting the formal eligibility criteria, budgets and ethical compliance of the different projects.
